text: The metacarpophalangeal joints (MCP) are between the bones in the hand at the palm called metacarpals, and the first finger bones called proximal phalanges. The palm bones have rounded ends, and the finger bone ends are shaped like caves. This helps the two bones fit together like a puzzle. ==Structure== ===Ligaments=== Category:Limbs and extremities
title: Metacarpophalangeal joint
